wnt.messages.cfx.rcprompt.title: Are you sure you want to run this command?
text.autoconfig.wnt-cfx.title: CFX Settings
text.autoconfig.wnt-cfx.option.nbtPatche:
Patches a client-side exploit where encountering an item with
too much NBT kicks the client from the server.

This does not have any effect for users running DeviousMod.
text.autoconfig.wnt-cfx.option.packetPat: Maximum amount of particles that can be summoned at once
This has no effect if the above setting is set to "No".
Limit how many particles can be summoned at once

An exploit is present that causes clients to freeze if they
try to handle too many particles at once.

This mitigates the exploit by adding a cut-off for how many
particles can be handled at once.
text.autoconfig.wnt-cfx.option.rendererP: Limit how large entity names can be when rendered

When rendering entities, the client has a tendency to lag horridly
when dealing with entities with massive names.

This option determines whether or not to limit how large an
entity's name can be before it gets cut off.
Maximum length of entity names when rendered
This has no effect if the above setting is set to "No".
Limit how many hearts can be rendered at once

When rendering the HUD, the client has a tendency to lag horridly
when you have an excessive amount of health.

This option determines whether or not to limit how many hearts
can be rendered.
Maximum number of hearts to render
This has no effect if the above setting is set to "No".
text.autoconfig.wnt-cfx.option.compPatch:
An exploit is present in 1.17.1 - 1.18 where clients can crash
trying to process certain texts that contain invalid identifiers.

This setting decides whether or not to patch the exploit.
This does not have any effect for users running 1.18.1+.
Method of handling invalid entity UUID crash exploit

An exploit is present in 1.17.1 - 1.18 where clients can crash
trying to process certain texts that contain invalid UUIDs.

This setting decides how it will be patched, which is noted below:
 - §aSILENT: §rSilently discards the hoverable part altogether.
 - §aVISIBLE: §rReplaces exploit UUIDs with
 "DEADDEAD-DEAD-DEAD-DEAD-DEADDEADDEAD".
 - §aOFF: §rDoes nothing, causing affected clients to crash.

This does not have any effect for users running 1.18.1+.
Method of handling text that runs commands

Perhaps one of the most well-known exploits is the infamous "command
books" exploit, where it is possible (by design) to run commands by
clicking text that has a hidden payload in it.

This setting decides how the exploit is processed, which is noted below:
 - §aSILENT: §rSilently ignores all clicks.
 - §aPROMPT: §rPrompts you to confirm on whether or not you want to run it.
 - §aOFF: §rRuns the command without any hesitation.
Limit how much text can be suggested by clicking text

An exploit is present in the client where it is possible to crash
clients by clicking text with a massive payload in them that
tells the client to suggest it as a command.

This decides whether or not to cap said payload. The setting
below is what determines the cap.
Maximum length of command suggestions from clicking text
This has no effect if the above setting is set to "No".
Enforce boundaries on selective translation arguments

An exploit is present in 1.17+ clients where it is possible to
crash them by causing them to try to process out-of-bounds
translation string arguments.

This setting decides whether to patch said exploit.
Enforce a limit on how many placeholders can be processed at a time

A critical exploit is present in 1.7+ where it is possible to
crash both servers and clients by utilizing a specially-crafted
translation component.

This setting decides whether or not to patch said exploit.
